text: The 1966–67 NCAA College Division men's ice hockey season began in November 1966 and concluded in March of the following year. This was the 3rd season of second-tier college ice hockey. ECAC 2 added Boston State who was an NAIA school. Normally the conference would be forbidden to add a non-NCAA school as a member but because there was no national tournament for College Division schools no penalty was imposed. ==Regular season== ===Season tournaments=== {| class="wikitable" ! Tournament || Dates || Teams || Champion |- | Amherst College Tournament | December 17–19 | | |- | Yankee Conference Tournament | December 27–28 | 4 | New Hampshire |- | Codfish Bowl | | 4 | Boston State |- |} ===Standings=== ==See also== * 1966–67 NCAA University Division men's ice hockey season ==References== ==External links== NCAA
title: 1966–67 NCAA College Division men's ice hockey season
